column4: Can someone gimme a hand? I need to run a command in gnome terminal on boot. How? :(
I know. But I don't know the command for running a specific command in gnome-terminal
gnome-terminal should have a cmdline switch for this
it's right there, the first option
I tried that though. The gnome-terminal window comes up, and goes away straight away
that means your command has finished, probably
append a "; read foo" to your command
It hasn't though. When I run it in an already open window, the command keeps going.
do the read foo thing, maybe your program is not being found or something.
I'm using this line: gnome-terminal -e=cd\ /media/Win98/moojava/classes;\ java\ runTWOServer;
well, I don't know about your runTWOServer ... do the read foo thing ;)  (and escape spaces as needed or put the whole thing in quotes)
ah ... it's not a bash that's executing the commands
